trans-unit.source:
\n

Specifies the type of persistence to use when serializing a property on a component at design time.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Specifies that a serializer should serialize the contents of the property, rather than the property itself.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx$ xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Specifies that a serializer should not serialize the value of the property.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Specifies that a serializer should be allowed to serialize the value of the property.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if obj is equal to this instance; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx $xx$xxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the hash code for this object.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating the basic serialization mode a serializer should use when determining whether and how to persist the value of a property.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx x xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x
